name: Architecture Decision Record Quality Rubric

criteria.name: Context Clarity
criteria.description: Context section clearly explains WHY this decision is needed, without proposing solutions

scoring.1: No context or context is vague/unhelpful
scoring.2: Some context but missing key requirements or constraints
scoring.3: Context explains situation with main requirements/constraints
scoring.4: Comprehensive context with background, requirements, and constraints
scoring.5: Exceptional context that future readers with no knowledge can fully understand

criteria.name: Decision Specificity
criteria.description: Decision statement is specific, actionable, and unambiguous

scoring.1: Vague or no clear decision stated
scoring.2: Decision stated but lacks specifics (versions, scope, approach)
scoring.3: Decision is clear with main specifics
scoring.4: Decision is very specific with technical details and scope
scoring.5: Exceptionally detailed decision with configuration, versions, scope, and implementation approach

criteria.name: Alternatives Quality
criteria.description: Real alternatives documented with honest, balanced pros/cons

scoring.1: No alternatives or only straw man options
scoring.2: 1-2 alternatives but unfairly presented or minimal analysis
scoring.4: 3+ alternatives with honest, balanced analysis and specific reasons not chosen
scoring.5: Multiple well-researched alternatives with nuanced trade-offs and fair representation

criteria.name: Consequence Honesty
criteria.description: Consequences include both benefits AND drawbacks with realistic assessment

scoring.1: Only benefits listed or consequences are vague
scoring.2: Mostly benefits with token mention of downsides
scoring.3: Balanced benefits and drawbacks but somewhat general
scoring.4: Honest assessment of benefits, drawbacks, and risks with specifics
scoring.5: Exceptionally honest and nuanced consequences with quantified trade-offs and mitigation strategies

criteria.name: Technical Accuracy
criteria.description: Technical details are accurate, current, and specific

scoring.2: Some technical details but lacking accuracy or currency
scoring.4: High technical accuracy with specific versions, configurations, and current best practices
scoring.5: Exceptional technical depth with precise details, performance characteristics, and expert-level accuracy

criteria.name: Future Comprehension
criteria.description: Someone unfamiliar with current context can understand the decision

scoring.2: Some context but many gaps for outsiders
scoring.4: Clear to future readers with minimal context needed
scoring.5: Perfectly self-contained; any future reader can fully understand

criteria.name: Trade-off Transparency
criteria.description: Trade-offs are explicitly stated and downsides acknowledged

scoring.1: No acknowledgment of trade-offs or downsides
scoring.3: Trade-offs mentioned but not deeply explored
scoring.4: Clear articulation of trade-offs and what's being sacrificed
scoring.5: Exceptional transparency about trade-offs with explicit acceptance of costs

criteria.name: Structure and Organization
criteria.description: ADR follows standard structure and is well-organized

scoring.1: No clear structure or missing major sections
scoring.2: Basic structure but disorganized or incomplete sections
scoring.3: Follows standard ADR format with all key sections
scoring.4: Well-organized with clear sections and good flow
scoring.5: Exemplary structure with logical flow, clear headings, and easy navigation

criteria.name: Actionability
criteria.description: Decision is implementable; clear what to do next

scoring.1: Not clear what action to take
scoring.2: General direction but unclear how to implement
scoring.3: Clear decision that can be implemented
scoring.5: Exceptionally actionable with rollout plan, success criteria, and next steps

criteria.name: Appropriate Scope
criteria.description: ADR covers one decision at appropriate level of detail

scoring.1: Too broad (multiple unrelated decisions) or too narrow (trivial)
scoring.2: Scope issues but decision is identifiable
scoring.3: Appropriate scope for a single significant decision
scoring.5: Perfect scope; focused on one decision with appropriate detail level

thresholds.excellent: Average score ≥ 4.5 (high-stakes decisions should aim for this)
thresholds.very_good: Average score ≥ 4.0 (most ADRs should achieve this)
thresholds.needs_rework: Average score < 3.0 (should be revised before finalizing)

decision_stakes_guidance.low_stakes: Reversible decisions, low cost to change: aim for ≥ 3.5
decision_stakes_guidance.medium_stakes: Some migration cost, affects multiple teams: aim for ≥ 4.0
decision_stakes_guidance.high_stakes: Expensive to reverse, organization-wide impact: aim for ≥ 4.5

usage_instructions: Rate each criterion independently on 1-5 scale. Calculate average score. For high-stakes decisions (affecting entire organization, expensive to reverse), aim for ≥4.5 average. For medium-stakes decisions, aim for ≥4.0. Minimum acceptable score is 3.5. Identify lowest-scoring criteria and improve those sections before delivering to user.
